translations.comp.labelInfo.title: KEYWORDS
translations.comp.labelInfo.p1: By default, semantic search automatically expands your keywords to similar words (searching for {$START_BOLD_TEXT}ai{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} will also include results containg {$START_BOLD_TEXT}artificial intelligence{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} as well as {$START_BOLD_TEXT}machine learning{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} for instance). To disable keyword expansion and revert to classic (strict) search, use double quotes ({$START_BOLD_TEXT}"ai"{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}).
translations.comp.labelInfo.p2: The operator AND can be used for conjunction: {$START_BOLD_TEXT}green AND carbon{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} only retrieves documents containing both words in any order.
translations.comp.labelInfo.p3: To also include documents containing either word, use {$START_BOLD_TEXT}green OR carbon{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}.
translations.comp.labelInfo.p4: To exclude one term from the results, you can you the - (NOT) operator : {$START_BOLD_TEXT}green -carbon{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} (projects containing "green" but not "carbon").
translations.comp.labelInfo.p5: You can also search for an exact expression using double quotes: {$START_BOLD_TEXT}"artificial intelligence"{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} only returns results with the words in that order.
translations.comp.labelInfo.p6: Additionally, you can use the star operator as a wildcard: {$START_BOLD_TEXT}govern{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}* will match government, governing, governors, etc. (minimum 3 characters before the *).
translations.comp.semanticTerm.title: Also matching:
translations.comp.advancedFilters.title: ADVANCED FILTERS
